page.title: 08THE SEVERN TUNNEL
page.content: {The Severn Tunnel}was opened in 1903 and shortened the route between Paddington and South Wales by 25 miles The River Severn which has an extraordinary range of tides, the rise and fall being as much as 50 feet (the highest in Europe and the 2nd highest in the world) has the longest under-water Railway Tunnel in the World passing beneath its bed. It is four miles,628 yards long-seven miles including approach cuttings. It took thirteen years to build: {1872}Act of Parliament authorising construction {1873}Work commenced by G.W.R. with direct labour. {1879}16 October work abandoned owing to tapping of great spring which flooded the works. Took a year to master.
